summary:
Methodology driven professional with multidisciplinary orientation and interest

• Eager to learn: motivated to develop skills and knowledge, confident and self-reflective

• Determined: persistent, passionate and intrinsically motivated

• Obtain tomorrow's solutions today: anticipate environmental, market and organizational demands, helicopter view, entrepreneurial, incrementalist


Specialties: operations, quality, engineering, six sigma (6σ), automotive, supply chain, process management, business intelligence, higher education

profile_positions.description:
Responsibilities:
• Define operational strategy, policy,  annual plan, annual operational budget and KPIs
• Lead the operational team functions and processes, including Production, Engineering, Procurement, Warehouse and IT
• Stimulate personal development and knowledge and competences
• Drive necessary training, investments, competences, production technologies based on operational policy
• Determine working methods, procedures, rules and instructions
• Secure qualification of people, materials, machines, means for manufacturing, working processes and services
• Plan and align the production based on required and available capacity
• Secure optimal labor conditions and workplace safety
• Member of the Executive Board
• Ensure the organization meets standards including IATF16949, ISO9001, ISO14001
profile_positions.title: Manager Operations

profile_positions.description:
Responsibilities:
• Multi-site quality leader, supervising 4 production locations, multiple assembly locations, local quality and supplier quality teams
• Responsible for global quality management and compliance of Global Portable Security products. Responsible for product, project and process quality for the brands AXA, Trelock and Kryptonite, both for production, sourced goods and over 100 annual new product developments
• Responsible for the Quality Strategy, Quality Policy, roadmap, Annual Operating Plan, metrics and planning & control cycle
• Responsible for internal and external audit programs, including audits by legislators, certifying agencies and ISO 9001:2015
• Responsible for the definition and implementation of global procedures 
• Supplier Quality Assurance Manager for European suppliers
• Application of QM, QP, QA, QC, QI activities and instruments
• Member of the GPS Operations Management Team

Achievements:
• Significantly reduced COPQ (scrap, rework and warranty costs) 75% and CPPM (number of detective customer products) 50%
• Matured processes and organization, e.g. on New Product Development, A3, 8D, 5S, MDI, ESG
• Introduced new processes including RMA, Requirements Management, Product Change Management and Material Compliance
• Process Management and Program Management for Material Compliance (incl. REACH, RoHS, Prop65)
• Developed new metrics including supplier performance and SIOP forecast algorithm
• Led project to analyze star ratings of end consumers
• Set up quality organization founded by clear accountability structures (separation of duties)
• Automated data structures to automate reporting, visualize output and track and improve on KPIs
• Improved supplier performance
• Successfully supported the relocation of production and warehouse to Veenendaal (NL) plant
profile_positions.title: Quality Manager Global Portable Security

profile_positions.description:
Responsibilities:
• Develop and manage Demand Planning & Logistics Engineering team, including demand planners, logistics engineers, data specialists, OSMI coordinator and EDI coordinator
• Manage all internal projects, processes and activities related to data management and reporting, metrics, process management, quality management, demand planning, Sales&Operations Planning, stock control, forecasting, EDI, IT systems (ERP), communication, MS SharePoint
• Lead Materials staff and functions needed to support demand planning for the global PACCAR Parts aftermarket supply chain
• Member of the Materials management team
• Program manager for global kitting program
• Six Sigma champion for Materials department
• Project leader or participant in large projects
• Workshop and High Impact Kaizen Event leader
• Data analysis of supply chain performance, constraints and strategic outlook

Achievements:
• Created department strategy, operational activities and competence matrix
• Steered Planning & Control routines towards lean reporting and archiving
• Introduced new metrics and reports for supply chain performance
• Introduced standardized way of working, action reports and review mechanism for demand planning to achieve percentual forecast error objectives
• Introduced new ERP system versions for distribution network and dealer network and risk mitigation mechanisms for ERP systems
• Aligned global stakeholder needs for emerging markets, marketing and sales actions to adapt forecasts in ERP systems in a standardized way
• Introduced recurrent meeting to manage and adapt stock control, a.o. on safety stock and stock reservations
• Introduced Quality Management procedure, standardized recurrent way of working, new database and digital scrap authorization process for OSMI stock control
• Introduced digital KANBAN project planning for team in MS Office 365
profile_positions.title: Manager Demand Planning & Logistics Engineering

profile_positions.description:
Responsibilities:
•	Quality Assurance (QA) and Quality Control (QC) of new engine and vehicle product development projects
•	Implement, apply, audit and continually improve QA related products, processes and provision according to the Automotive SPiCE assessment model and standards including ISO 9001 (Quality Management), ISO/IATF 16949 (Quality Management System for Automotive Industry) and ISO 26262 (Functional Safety)
•	Member of the Management Team Product Development / Quality
•	Direct report to the Director Product Development
•	Organization of QA progress with PACCAR internal stakeholders

Achievements:
•	Applied business management analytics to map and forecast quality, costs, timing and performance of complexity, resources, activities, departments, in/through/outputs to obtain mutual relations to identify and focus on relevant quality subjects, secure long term competitiveness and reduce time-to-market and costs
•	Measured and improved performance of business processes
•	Directed towards fully automated reporting mechanisms of KPIs, project portfolio, processes and department performance
•	Led teams to create and improve QA roadmap, strategy, procedure, project plans and monitor, aligned to stakeholder needs
•	Initiated analysis of project interfaces to environmental business and technical risks
•	Initiated and executed several QA activities, e.g. training, coaching, workshops, mediation, assessments, instructions
•	Executed majority of department's QC activities with 24h service constraint
profile_positions.title: Quality Assurance Officer

profile_positions.description:
Research, development and validation of electronic diagnostics architecture to be applied on future generation PACCAR Diesel engines in compliance with NA/EU legislation on heavy duty vehicles.

Responsibilities:
• Project Lead Engineer OBD Advanced Technologies
• Development, calibration and assessment of Air Management OBD diagnostics systems
• Data analysis of test bench and field data

Achievements:
• Initiation and development of an in-house Matlab interface for high-end data analysis and visualization, data mining, OBD fault probability and robustness statistics, Model-in-the-Loop and regression testing. The program aims to improve quality of deliverables (validation of software units, integrated software units, calibrations) while significantly reducing costs
• Quality Control and application of Six Sigma to optimize quality of software related deliverables
• Development of OBD software diagnostics, including requirements management, validation and verification
• Team member of several methodology projects including HiL and MiL technology, software robustness and calibration quality
profile_positions.title: Development Engineer On Board Diagnostics

profile_positions.description:
Research summary: a well connects subsurface oil reservoirs to surface facilities. If the pressure and temperature conditions allow, gas bubbles form in the wellhead during flowing conditions. If this multiphase flow stops by closing the wellhead valve (shut-in), phase redistribution occurs: the liquid drains to the bottom while the gas floats to the wellhead. Thermodynamics, heat transfer and mass transfer all affect the gas cap size that results at the wellhead. After wellhead valve reopening, gas expansion associated with Joule Thomson cooling leads to low fluid temperatures and risk of brittle fracture of well material. Hence, accurate knowledge of the gas cap size after shut-in is important.

A fully coupled 1D multiphase flow simulator, with motion and condensation of bubbles modeled coarsely, has been used in the past to determine the gas cap size. As motion and condensation of bubbles are expected to be decisive for the gas cap size, the present study takes a distinctive approach: employ Newton’s 2nd law to track individual bubbles, combined with a condensation model based on molecular diffusion. Simulations have been carried out for mono- and polydisperse bubble groups and for the case of artificial gas lift. A sensitivity study has been carried out on various physical parameters. The results mainly suggest that the gas cap size that forms at the wellhead is smaller than predicted by the 1D multiphase flow simulator.
profile_positions.title: Graduation Internship - Shell Global Solutions; Upstream; Flow Assurance

profile_positions.description:
• Aerodynamics research on transition behavior of composite wing panels for the Airbus A350 project
• Benchmarking of dedicated aerodynamics tooling in the aerospace industry
• Invitee of Flight Physics department management meetings

volunteer_experiences.description: Part-time board member, responsibility for making and executing the financial policy of an association of apartment owners.

Think tank of young professionals aiming to strengthen cross-sectoral cooperation and knowledge transfer to succeed in the energy transition and provide input for the 2019 Climate Treaty of the Dutch government.

Discussion group with members of the Ministry of Education, Associations (VSNU, Vereniging van Hogescholen), politicians, law professionals and higher education professionals on Dutch higher education law (WHW), legal protection of stakeholders, macro efficiency of the system and governance and accountability in higher education.
